title: Online Leadership Education Design: Grounded Theory-Based Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate Expertise in Library and Information Science, with Foundational Leadership Concepts
context.additional_context: Majority of learners are female professionals; instructional design must account for sociocultural contexts (e.g., gender bias) in leadership training and online learning

learning_goals: Participants can integrate feminist theory with contemporary leadership models to design leadership strategies suitable for library environments
Participants can develop case-based leadership training modules using grounded theory methodology
Participants can identify and mitigate gender-discriminatory elements in online learning environments through small-group settings
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
